title: Executive Order 8207-Exemption of Dr. George F. Bowerman From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Dr. George F. Bowerman, Librarian, Free Public Library of the District of Columbia, who was exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending September 30, 1939, by Executive Order No. 7892 of May 18, 1938, be further exempted from such compulsory retirement for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby further exempt the said Dr. George F. Bowerman from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending September 30, 1940.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8207-Exemption of Dr. George F. Bowerman From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362958
